We Are All Set To See Leander Paes In Action Again After The Veteran Finds A Place In Davis Cup Team For Pakistan Clash

We Are All Set To See Leander Paes In Action Again After The Veteran Finds A Place In Davis Cup Team For Pakistan Clash

The AITA has been forced to fall back on Leander Paes for Davis Cup Asia-Oceania Group-I tie against Pakistan after Mahesh Bhupathi and leading doubles player Rohan Bopanna refused to travel to Islamabad for security concerns.

Twitter

The tie is scheduled is to take place on November 29-30. However, AITA has requested the ITF to relocate the fixture to a neutral venue take the final will be taken on November 4.

According to the list submitted by AITA to the Pakistan Tennis Federation (PTF) for initiating the visa process, Paes’ name has been forwarded as a player after the 46-year-old made himself available for the tie. Paes last featured in a Davis tie in April 2018 after he won the history-creating doubles match against China.

Others to be named include Saketh Myneni, Arjun Kadhe, Vijay Sundar Prashanth, N Sriram Balaji, Siddharth Rawat and Manish Suresh Kumar. Coach Syed Zeeshan Ali, manager Sunder Narayan Iyer and physio Anand Kumar have bene named as support staff.

Apart from Bhupathi and Bopanna, other players reluctant to travel to Islamabad include top singles players Ramkumar Ramanathan, Sumit Nagal and Sasi Kumar Mukund. India’s best-ranked singles player, Prajnesh Gunneswaran, is also not available for the tie as he’s getting married on November 29, the opening day of the tie.

It’s been learnt that apart from featuring in the doubles rubber, Paes could also double up as the captain in the absence of Bhupathi. AITA secretary general Hironmoy Chatterjee informed that a final call regarding the entry of players will be taken only after ITF’s decision on November 4. If ITF accepts AITA’s demand and shifts the tie out of Islamabad to a neutral venue, both Bhupathi and Bopanna, along with other singles players, will be drafted back into the players’ list and Paes’ name will be recalled.

“We decided to send the names to the PTF to start the visa formalities as it’s a long process. We will come to know about the final decision from the ITF on November 3 and will select the team after that,” Chatterjee told TOI. “Paes has been named as a player because he has made himself available. As for making him the captain, I can’t say anything at this moment,” he added. The tie was earlier scheduled to be held in Islamabad on September 14-15 but was postponed to November.

With Inputs From TOI.
description: The All India Tennis Association (AITA) has been forced to fall back on ageless Leander Paes for India’s highly-anticipated Davis Cup Asia-Oceania Group-I tie against Pakistan after both non-playing captain Mahesh Bhupathi and leading doubles player Rohan Bopanna refused to travel to Islamabad, citing security concerns.
